meaning_str.bing:
n. 〈非正式〉疯子
adj. (发)疯的；神经病的；疯癫的；不理智的
网络. 疯狂；疯狂的；疯了

(发)疯的；神经病的；疯癫的；不理智的

疯狂的；狂热的；着迷的；的；不理智的；患精神病的；极度激动的；非常生气的；不安全的；危险的；不稳定的；古怪的；异想天开的
疯子；狂人；怪人；狂热者；精神错乱者；极度热衷者

1.en: eg, There is no freedom to blow off steam or to do something just a little crazy!
1.cn: 有一点自吹自擂或做点疯狂事情的自由！

2.en: The most effective way is to go crazy with him. After both of you calm down , tell him softly that you love him.
2.cn: 最有效的办法是陪他一起疯，等他平静后轻轻的告诉他，你很爱他。

3.en: Apparently, there was such a severe famine, that the king of Lydia decided that they had to do something crazy. People were suffering.
3.cn: 显然，历史上曾经有过这么一次严重的饥荒Lydia国王决定做一些他们不得不做的疯狂的事情当时人民在遭受痛苦，互相争斗形式非常危机。

0.en: Then something crazy. That's more like it.
0.cn: 那就做件疯狂的事吧。这样才像话。

1.en: Joey, we're trying to dial down the crazy. Right.
1.cn: 我们不想听那些疯狂的事。对。

2.en: Egypt went crazy, Amanda Bynes went crazier, And the NSA checks our phones like a crazy ex-girlfriend.
2.cn: 埃及暴乱了 阿曼达·拜恩斯也更加疯癫，国家安全局监控我们的手机 就如同疯狂的前女友般。

3.en: I know, it was crazy. I wasn't even wearing my Aquasocks. Then...
3.cn: 我知道这挺疯狂的，我连耐克户外鞋都没穿呢。接下来……

4.en: Toad of truth? Is that a physics thing? No, that's a crazy thing.
4.cn: 真理的蛤蟆？这是物理学上的名词吗？不，那是疯狂的产物。

5.en: Nothing. I just had a crazy dream. About what? What were you dreaming about?
5.cn: 没什么，做了个疯狂的梦而已。关于什么? 你梦到什么了?

6.en: I don't believe in these crazy diets you know, just everything in moderation.
6.cn: 我不相信疯狂的节食法，只要正常饮食就行了。

7.en: It's all that time he spends in the plaza. Fills his head with crazy fantasies.
7.cn: 这就是他在广场上干的好事，满脑子装的都是些疯狂的幻想。

8.en: What would happen to an astronaut daring or crazy enough to dive in feet-first?
8.cn: 对于一位足够勇敢或疯狂的宇航员脚先着地潜入会发生什么?

9.en: And if I may get serious for a moment, hosting this show has been one crazy ride.
9.cn: 请容许我认真地说几句，主持这档节目是一段疯狂的旅程。

10.en: But my point is that I love my crazy family, and I want to spend this holiday with them.
10.cn: 但我想说的是，我爱我疯狂的家人们，我想跟我的家人们一起过这个感恩节。

11.en: Are you going to start again? I am tired of hearing you rant about the crazy closet world.
11.cn: 你又要再来一次吗？我已经受够了听你唠叨疯狂的衣柜界的事了。

12.en: I don't know, she seemed to think it was such a crazy idea. You know, plus, she got me taffy.
12.cn: 她似乎觉得那是个疯狂的点子，而且她送我太妃糖。

13.en: Fair warning, we can get crazy. Yeah. Last week we smoked cigars and pretended to be dragons.
13.cn: 友情提示: 我们会变得很疯狂的哦。是呀，上周我们抽了雪茄，还假装自己是龙呢。

14.en: Why would I rant about crazy closet world? Those lunatics priced themselves out of business years ago.
14.cn: 我为什么要唠叨"疯狂的衣柜界"呢？那家公司早就因为定价过高而没有销路了。

15.en: Huh? What? This is my bachelorette party, tea and quilts? Well, you said you didn't want anything crazy.
15.cn: 怎么了？怎么回事？这是我的单身派对，喝茶和缝被子吗？你自己说不要太疯狂的。

16.en: This morning Sheldon fell asleep on the way to work, so I got to listen to the radio, that was pretty crazy.
16.cn: 早上谢尔顿在去上班的路上睡着了，所以我有机会听广播，好疯狂的一早。

17.en: Why would you say that? Because ever since I've met you, you've shown me how to do stuff I never dreamed of doing. Crazy things!
17.cn: 你怎么会那么说？自从我认识你，你一直让我看到如何去做想都不敢想的事。疯狂的事。

18.en: So, Howard Wolowitz tying the knot. Leaving his crazy bachelor days behind. He was a wild one. Well, I guess we all kind of were.
18.cn: 霍华德·沃罗威茨要结婚了，要将疯狂的单身生活抛诸脑后，他是个疯狂的人。不过，我们又何尝不是呢？

19.en: I never thought I would be addressing you, the esteemed members of the Oxford Union without a guitar, or an Erhu, without my crazy stage hair, costumes.
19.cn: 我从来没有想过我能对你们，尊敬的牛津辩论社社员发表演讲，没有带吉他或者二胡，没有疯狂的发型，演出服。
